business.headline: Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

Varun Dhawan gifts his sunglasses to young fan at airport, wins hearts. WatchActor Varun Dhawan gave his sunglasses to a young fan at Mumbai airport on Friday. The actor recently wrapped up the Pune schedule of his upcoming film 'Border 2'.

Maalik vs Aankhon… box office Day 1: Rajkummar's film outshines Shanaya's debutRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' opened with a modest Rs 3.35 crore on Day 1 amidst tough competition. Meanwhile, Shanaya Kapoor's debut 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' witnessed a slow start.

Anupam Kher hosts special screening of Tanvi The Great for President MurmuThe President of India, Droupadi Murmu, watched the eagerly awaited film 'Tanvi The Great' at a special screening in Rashtrapati Bhavan. Featuring a stellar cast, it releases on July 18.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

Anurag Kashyap says Siddhant Chaturvedi's comment changed Ananya PandayAnurag Kashyap praised Ananya Panday's growth as an actor, highlighting her maturity and risk-taking in career choices despite being a 'nepo baby'.

Shiva Rajkumar: Beyond bloodline, a powerhouse who redefined Kannada cinemaAt 63, with almost four decades of stardom behind him and no signs of slowing down, Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar stands as the powerhouse of the Kannada film industry. But what about him attracts such devotion and respect?

Coco Jones and Donovan Mitchell announce engagement after secret romance Grammy winner Coco Jones and NBA star Donovan Mitchell announced their engagement after two years of dating, sharing a romantic video and photo while opening up about their formerly private relationship.

Paul McCartney announces 2025 'Got Back' tour with 19 North American datesPaul McCartney's 2025 Got Back Tour spans 19 North American cities, starting September 29. Presale access begins July 15. Major stops include Las Vegas, Nashville, Montreal, and Chicago.

Julian McMahon's cause of death confirmed as metastatic cancerJulian McMahon, known for Nip/Tuck and Charmed, died at 56 from metastatic cancer. Co-stars Alyssa Milano and Ioan Gruffudd paid tribute to his talent, warmth, and enduring presence.
Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendFrom documentaries and suspense thrillers to reality series, here's what you can watch on JioHotstar this weekend.

Director James Gunn calls Govinda's Superman meme the bestAhead of 'Superman's India release, James Gunn shared a special message for Indian fans and laughed over Govinda's viral Superman meme from 'Dariya Dil', calling it "the best." The video, also featuring stars David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, invited Indian audiences to catch the film in theatres.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendPrime Video's new weekend lineup offers a diverse mix of genres, from gripping documentaries and thrilling suspense to action-packed dramas and quirky horror comedies. Indian viewers can enjoy top picks like 'Zero Se Restart,' 'Ballard,' and 'Karate Kid: Legends' for an entertaining and relaxed weekend.

Karan Johar breaks silence on Dhadak 2 delay, praises censor board's sensitivity'Dhadak 2' explores caste-based injustice with a commitment to meaningful storytelling by Dharma Productions. The film's complex certification process highlights collaboration with the CBFC for sensitive content.

Sanjay Dutt on Leo: Loved working with Thalapathy Vijay but Lokesh wasted meAs Sanjay Dutt continues his pan-India journey with back-to-back big-ticket films, the actor recently voiced his disappointment over his limited role in Thalapathy Vijay-starrer 'Leo'.

Does James Gunn's Superman make a subtle commentary on Israel-Ghaza war: ExplainedActor David Corenswet's sci-fi action-drama 'Superman' (2025) has sparked online debate over its subtle commentary on the Israel-Ghaza war. Despite director James Gunn refraining from any kind of direct political messaging, audiences have their own interpretations of the movie.

Why did Salman Khan choose Chitrangda Singh for Battle of Galwan? She answersChitrangda Singh joins Salman Khan in 'Battle of Galwan', a war drama based on the 2020 Galwan Valley clash, directed by Apoorva Lakhia. She calls it a special project, especially because of her army background and a long-awaited collaboration with Salman.

BTS' V shares Paris pics, fans wonder if he's in Seoul or Los AngelesBTS member V's whereabouts spark fan frenzy, with speculation rife over whether he's in Los Angeles, Seoul, or Paris. Here's what we know.

general news.headline: Seconds before Mayday, Air India fuel switches turned back from 'cutoff' to 'run'While the first engine's core deceleration stopped, reversed, and began to recover, the second engine could not arrest its deceleration, according to the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's report released today, a month after the June 12 crash.

7 years ago, US body flagged potential fuel control switch issue on 737 jetsAir India crash probe: Since the bulletin by the FAA was advisory and not mandatory, Air India did not perform the recommended inspections.

You spent Rs 2.5 crore on me, have faith: Radhika Yadav tried to counsel fatherTennis player Radhika Yadav's father, Deepak, spent over Rs 2.5 crore on her tennis training. However, an injury suffered two years ago kept Radhika away from pursuing a career in tennis.

Decoding the fuel switches behind the deadly Air India crashUnderstanding how these switches function and their critical role in flight operations is essential for grasping the sequence of events that led to the disaster.

Wimbledon: Once time-proof, Novak Djokovic finally looked mortalWimbledon 2025: For nearly two decades, Novak Djokovic defied time with grit and brilliance. But on Centre Court, against a rising Jannik Sinner, he looked powerless to stop the clock. The warrior who once bent eras to his will finally appeared mortal.

'I didn't cut off fuel': Cockpit exchange of Air India pilots before crashAs per the report, one of the pilots aboard the ill-fated Air India Boeing 787 that crashed in Ahmedabad on June 12 asked, "Why did you cutoff the fuel?" The other pilot responded, "I did not do so."

Why Bengaluru's chicken-rice for stray dogs is a bone of contentionBengaluru's civic body, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), plans to serve chicken-rice to 5,000 street dogs every day at an annual cost of Rs 2.88 crore. The plan is aimed at curbing the aggression of dogs. Supporters call it humane, while critics slam it as a misuse of taxpayer money. Here's the debate.

RCB, cops knew felicitation was unmanageable, still went ahead: Stampede reportThe Justice D'Cunha-led inquiry commission, which was appointed by the Karnataka government, concluded that the organisers and authorities went ahead with the RCB felicitation event knowing it was impossible to conduct it safely.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Concern for India as debt diplomacy sees Bangladesh, Pakistan converge with ChinaWith its debt diplomacy, China has turned Pakistan into its vassal state. Now, it is trying the same in Bangladesh, whose economy is in tatters. This has resulted in the convergence of the interests of Beijing with those of Islamabad and Dhaka in India's backyard, a concern which was recently flagged by CDS General Anil Chauhan.

Isro reveals Shux's recovery plans after returning from spaceIsro's medical team has been closely monitoring Shukla's health throughout the mission, reporting that he remains in excellent condition and high spirits.

Was Radhika's killer-father shamed for living off her income? Cops doubt thatUnconvinced by the theory, the police pointed out that Deepak's monthly income was in lakhs. 'So why would anyone taunt him like that?', a police source told India Today TV, adding that Deepak would get angry over small matters.

Floating hotels, silk trails and jungle safaris: India's cruise storyCruises - both domestic and international - are emerging as the next big travel trend in India. A new travel trend report by SOTC and Thomas Cook notes that Indians are increasingly opting for new and unique travel formats, with cruises topping the list.

Two dead in four-storey building collapses in Delhi, 10 rescued so farA four-storey building collapsed in Delhi's Seelampur area around 7 am, trapping several people; rescue ops are ongoing with some people feared trapped and ten rescued so far.

Cricket may have given Karun Nair a second chance, but his time is running outKarun Nair's return to the Indian cricket team seemed like an inspirational non-fiction novel for the ages. But his time in England seems to be a horror story at the moment and the time is running out for the 33-year-old.

The 98-second life of doomed Air India flightThe flight took off at 1:38 pm after receiving take-off clearance. The flight was just 32 seconds in the air, before it eventually crashed, according to the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's 15-page preliminary probe report.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Video: Newly-married couple tied to yoke like oxen, forced to plough fieldThe Odisha couple recently got married, going against community norms as the man is said to be the son of the woman's paternal aunt, a relationship considered taboo under the village's traditional customs.

No CV or degree needed: Bengaluru AI startup offers Rs 1 crore jobSmallest AI founder Sudarshan Kamath has posted a Rs 1 crore tech job that skips degrees and resumes -- just proof of work and a short intro. The hiring style is going viral online.

Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

Weed and longevity don't mix: Bryan Johnson's anti-cannabis take explainedWhen the tech multi-millionaire publishes his "Don't Do" list, people in the health and wellness world tend to listen. On that list, nestled amongst predictable no-nos like smoking cigarettes or binge-watching TV, is something that doesn't surprise many: cannabis. Here's why science backs his theory too...

Football federation confirms ISL on hold, awaits top court order to decide fateThe AIFF has officially paused the Indian Super League for 2025–26, citing ongoing Supreme Court proceedings. While fans await clarity, efforts are ongoing behind the scenes to bring the league back stronger.

No Aadhaar, voter ID in Bihar poll roll revision? Why top court voiced concernThe Supreme Court has raised questions about the Election Commission's requirement for multiple documents in Bihar's voter roll revision. The move risks disenfranchising migrants and vulnerable groups, raising fears of a de facto NRC.

Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

Varun Dhawan gifts his sunglasses to young fan at airport, wins hearts. WatchIn a heartwarming gesture, actor Varun Dhawan gifted his sunglasses to a young fan at Mumbai airport on Friday. The actor recently wrapped up the Pune schedule of his upcoming film 'Border 2'.

sports.headline: Football federation confirms ISL on hold, awaits top court order to decide fateThe AIFF has officially paused the Indian Super League for 2025–26, citing ongoing Supreme Court proceedings. While fans await clarity, efforts are ongoing behind the scenes to bring the league back stronger.

Return to old Dukes, end saliva ban: Kumble on ball-controversy at Lord'sENG vs IND: Former India cricketer Anil Kumble has suggested that the current Duke's ball, which is under severe scrutiny, should be put aside and go back to the older ones that lasted much longer. This comes after the disappointment with the current ball used for the Lord's Test.

Joe Root on India's ball-change outburst: Can't keep slowing the game downENG vs IND: Joe Root acknowledged the challenges with the softening Dukes ball but urged players to adapt instead of stalling play — subtly referring to India's on-field disagreement with umpires over a ball change during the Lord's Test.

Jasprit Bumrah relishing Lord's honours board feat: A story for my sonENG vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah's 5/74 at Lord's earned him a spot on the Honours Board — a proud milestone he'll one day share as a story with his son, etched forever at the Home of Cricket.

Joe Burns journey: From MS Dhoni's farewell to leading Italy to T20 World CupJoe Burns led Italy to their maiden appearance in the 2026 T20 World Cup, set to be held in India and Sri Lanka. Italy secured their spot in the tournament after winning their final qualifying match against the Netherlands on Friday.

Archer does things others can't: Root on England's X-factor's Test returnJofra Archer received massive praise from England's Joe Root, who called him their X-factor with the ball. The pacer made his return to Test cricket after four years and made an impact straight away by dismissing Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Wimbledon: Once time-proof, Novak Djokovic finally looked mortalWimbledon 2025: For nearly two decades, Novak Djokovic defied time with grit and brilliance. But on Centre Court, against a rising Jannik Sinner, he looked powerless to stop the clock. The warrior who once bent eras to his will finally appeared mortal.

Bumrah refrains from commenting on Dukes ball: My match fee will get deductedIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah refrained from commenting on the Dukes ball controversy during Day 2 of the third Test against England at Lord's. Captain Shubman Gill had a heated argument with the on-field umpire over the condition of the changed ball in the first session.

3 challenges every 80 overs: Joe Root's DRS-esque solution for ball change issueJoe Root has suggested a solution for the frequent ball change issue in the ongoing series between England and India. There were frequent ball changes during Day 2 of the Lord's Test, which saw Shubman Gill have an animated chat with the umpires.

Sachin Tendulkar relishes his spot in a Federer-Borg Grand Slam sandwichSachin Tendulkar stole the spotlight at Wimbledon by posing between Roger Federer and Bjorn Borg, calling it a "Grand Slam sandwich" — a legendary crossover moment between cricket and tennis that fans won't forget.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
